comment.body:
I can reproduce it.
This rule:
```adblock
tingfm.com#%#//scriptlet('trusted-replace-node-text', 'script', 'wndt.can_run_ads', '/wndt\.can_run_ads.*=.*;/', 'wndt.can_run_ads = !0;')
```
should fixes it.
I will add it.

comment.body:
It's really hard to investigate when I'm not able to reproduce it.
You can try to disable current rule and combine it into one:
```adblock
facebook.com,facebookwkhpilnemxj7asaniu7vnjjbiltxjqhye3mhbshg7kx5tfyd.onion#@%#//scriptlet('json-prune-xhr-response', 'data.viewer.instream_video_ads data.scrubber', '', '/api/graphql')
facebook.com,facebookwkhpilnemxj7asaniu7vnjjbiltxjqhye3mhbshg7kx5tfyd.onion#%#//scriptlet('json-prune-xhr-response', 'data.viewer.instream_video_ads data.scrubber data.viewer.marketplace_feed_stories.edges.*.{-}.__typename.[=].MarketplaceFeedAdStory', '', '/api/graphql')
```
But if it still doesn't work then I would need to be able to reproduce this ad to check why.

comment.body:
Once again, the main problem is that I cannot reproduce it.
If I could, then I would create a rule.

Last attempt today:
```adblock
facebook.com#%#(()=>{const e={apply:(e,t,a)=>{if(a[2]?.[0]&&a[2][0].includes?.("MarketplaceFeedAdStory"))try{const e=a[2][0],t=e.split(/\r?\n|\r/).map((e=>JSON.parse(e)));t.forEach((e=>{if(e.data?.viewer?.marketplace_feed_stories?.edges){const t=e.data.viewer.marketplace_feed_stories.edges;t.forEach((a=>{a.node?.__typename?.includes("MarketplaceFeedAdStory")&&(e.data.viewer.marketplace_feed_stories.edges=t.filter((e=>!e.node?.__typename?.includes("MarketplaceFeedAdStory"))))}))}}));const r=t.map((e=>JSON.stringify(e))).join("\n");a[2][0]=r}catch(r){return console.trace(r),Reflect.apply(e,t,a)}return Reflect.apply(e,t,a)}};window.Function.prototype.call=new Proxy(window.Function.prototype.call,e)})();
```

issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS. 


Previous issue https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/198973

Finally.
Could you please check one more time, but now with this rule:
```adblock
facebook.com#%#(()=>{const e={apply:(e,t,a)=>{if(a[2]?.[0]&&a[2][0].includes?.("MarketplaceFeedAdStory"))try{const e=a[2][0],t=e.split(/\r?\n|\r/).map((e=>JSON.parse(e)));t.forEach((e=>{e.data?.viewer?.marketplace_feed_stories?.edges&&(e.data.viewer.marketplace_feed_stories.edges=e.data.viewer.marketplace_feed_stories.edges.filter((e=>!e.node?.__typename?.includes("MarketplaceFeedAdStory"))))}));const r=t.map((e=>JSON.stringify(e))).join("\n");a[2][0]=r}catch(r){return console.trace(r),Reflect.apply(e,t,a)}return Reflect.apply(e,t,a)}};window.Function.prototype.call=new Proxy(window.Function.prototype.call,e)})();
```
It's a bit simpified.

What about this one:
```adblock
facebook.com#%#(()=>{const e={apply:(e,t,a)=>{try{if(a[2]?.[0]&&a[2][0].includes?.("MarketplaceFeedAdStory")){const e=a[2][0],t=e.split(/\r?\n|\r/).map((e=>JSON.parse(e)));t.forEach((e=>{e.data?.viewer?.marketplace_feed_stories?.edges&&(e.data.viewer.marketplace_feed_stories.edges=e.data.viewer.marketplace_feed_stories.edges.filter((e=>!e.node?.__typename?.includes("MarketplaceFeedAdStory"))))}));const r=t.map((e=>JSON.stringify(e))).join("\n");a[2][0]=r}return Reflect.apply(e,t,a)}catch(r){return console.trace(r),Reflect.apply(e,t,a)}}};window.Function.prototype.call=new Proxy(window.Function.prototype.call,e)})();
```

comment.body:
Details

Cannot reproduce. Please try the following instructions one by one: 1. Reboot your computer. 2. Uncheck DPI protection option in AdGuard for Windows stealth section (Even if you did not mention it in the report, often it causes a `ERR_CONNECTION_RESET` issue.) 3. Reset AdGuard for Windows config. If the above all instructions do not work, please email support@adguard.com.

Most of the websites I visit (Celebrity Cruiseline, the Kitchn, other similar websites) the pictures are missing. Some are just blank and others have a question mark in the little box in the middle. On Facebook a box pops up saying there is a problem to try again later and I can get rid of that by refreshing the page. I paid for this version of AdGuard. comment.body: Dear the reporter, please don't use shortner for report.
@piquark6046 What? The URL is `www.city-yanai.jp`

That all depends, there's no simple canned answer. As I once said, you just have to think about the site owner's intention. `.min-h-` etc. are **in this case** the best, this may not be true on other cases.
Thank you

You missed the most (only?) important ad in the screenshot. You should give up the obssession for the top node, `sbird1125.blog.fc2.com##.af-box` is the best selector here that also covers the missed ad.
@Yuki2718 Then, do you want to prefer `min-*` CSS properties than `width`, `background-color` or `height`?
done

comment.body: @piquark6046 Remove this, blocking rss is not a job of Widget filter. blogroll (aka sougo-rss) is a different thing.

I'm saying "don't gamble", no more future breakage by such selectors, please... Creating filters is not a puzzle game to find a combination of selectors that just happened to match. Who cares that 20px? This is even less problem on PC, I'll change https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/commit/d48e650586202cbf65da30c32faecc726feafdc0 as undoubtedly `##.min-h-\[90px\].min-w-\[728px\]` is the best selector here.

comment.body: @Yuki2718 Do you want a filter like https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/commit/d48e650586202cbf65da30c32faecc726feafdc0?
But, `.flex.justify-center.bg-gray-200` indicates one type of elements, advert leftover while browsing the website.

@piquark6046 Please... don't gamble. It's only fortune the rule currently doesn't have FP. The only meaningful selector `.bg-gray-200` just specifies a background color and `##.bg-gray-200` has FPs, which happened to be cancelled by the other two almost meaningless classes. `.justify-center` has 54 matches and `.flex` 224, both of them are too generic. I'd go with `##.min-h-\[100px\].min-w-\[320px\]` as it's the best selector here and ignore 20px placeholder, but if you can't bear not to choose the top node, why don't use much more meaningful `.py-\[10px\]` that specifies padding-top/-bottom 10px, somewhat characteristic to such a box element and in fact only has 3 matches. It's still not safe enough and will better to be more specified, e.g. `##.xl\:block + div.bg-gray-200.py-\[10px\]`.
cc: @Alex-302

comment.body:
@wUEZRs On iOS / Safari on Mac we can only do what Apple explicitly allows us to do. Specifically, in this case, we are unable to use our own filtering engine, as we do on desktops and Android. We use the Safari Content Blocking API and our implementation of advanced blocking for Safari, which is also not all-powerful on this platform.

But on Mac users can use AdGuard for Mac - it is not limited by Apple's policies.

labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: NSFW
labels.description: Nudes and porn sites

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Anti Adblock Script) [NSFW] [https://gaystream.pw/view/blowing-a-responsive-hot-waiter-lorenzo/60138](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fgaystream.pw%2Fview%2Fblowing-a-responsive-hot-waiter-lorenzo%2F60138) ### Comment > ## Description > The website contains a video player named **"Multi HD"** that appears to use a highly sophisticated adblock-detection mechanism. > > When an ad blocker is enabled, the player displays the first overlay: > > *"You are using AdBlocker. The owner of this video doesn't allow AdBlocker. Please disable your AdBlocker, Thank you."* > > If this overlay is manually blocked, the player shows a second overlay: > > *"Video keep loading? Select a different server or refresh the page."* > > From my observation, once adblock usage is detected, the **actual video player** is never loaded at all. Instead, it is replaced entirely with one of these two overlays. This means the real video stream never initiates when adblock is detected. > > --- > > ## Steps to Reproduce > 1. Enable any ad blocker (AdGuard, uBlock Origin, etc.). > 2. Open the website containing the **"Multi HD"** player. > 3. Notice the first overlay appears. > 4. Block the first overlay element (e.g., via cosmetic filter). > 5. A second overlay appears instead, with no real video loaded. ### [NSFW] Screenshots [Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adtidy.org/sitereports/8iqc2bg77ew4wksc48w0w8sock00k00kme7zf7fw68.png?nc=1) ### System configuration Information | Value --- | --- AdGuard product: | AdGuard Browser Extension v5.1.102 MV2 System version: | `Windows 10` Browser: | Chrome Tracking protection: | **General settings**:
